definition: to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely

sentences.english: The workers laid about them to increase production.
sentences.chinese: 工人們竭盡全力增加生產。

sentences.english: Although the stone inflammation does utmost, still had lost to Chen Fei.
sentences.chinese: 雖然石炎竭盡全力，仍是輸給了陳飛。

sentences.english: Craig was an old friend, and I had done my best to bring them together.
sentences.chinese: 克雷格是我的老朋友，我竭盡全力讓他們一起合作。

sentences.english: McConnell said Republicans would fight the health-care legislation as hard as they could.
sentences.chinese: 麥康奈爾說，共和黨人將竭盡全力反對健保法案。

sentences.english: The prime minister would go to any lengths to keep his government in power.
sentences.chinese: 首相會竭盡全力務使他的政府能繼續執政。

sentences.english: “We are striving to learn from the Japanese event,” says Becker.
sentences.chinese: “我們在竭盡全力從日本事件中汲取教訓，”貝克說。

sentences.english: I tried my best to get some points for Toyota.
sentences.chinese: 我竭盡全力想爲豐田車隊掙得一些分數。

sentences.english: Suk is a good player and he always does his utmost.
sentences.chinese: 石是一名很棒的球員，並且他總是竭盡全力。

sentences.english: We are doing everything in our power to offer support and help.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在竭盡全力地提供支援和幫助。

sentences.english: So we do what we can to understand them, to be ready for change.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們竭盡全力去弄懂它們，爲改變做好準備。

sentences.english: China has help the tsunami-hit regions of Asia.
sentences.chinese: 中國承諾竭盡全力幫助受海嘯襲擊的亞洲地區。

sentences.english: A hero tries to do and give his very best.
sentences.chinese: 英雄總是想方計法並竭盡全力地做事。

sentences.english: She was also curious, and would have given much to find out the cause of Bertha's outburst .
sentences.chinese: 她還好奇，她將竭盡全力探出伯莎悲哀發作的原因。

sentences.english: They’d exhaust themselves trying to juggle family and work.
sentences.chinese: 他們要竭盡全力的去應付家庭和工作。

sentences.english: 'We tried really hard to push the spiral lamp,' he says.
sentences.chinese: 他說他們真的是竭盡全力地去推廣螺旋燈泡。

sentences.english: Try it: go outside and sprint all-out for two minutes.
sentences.chinese: 試試吧，走到外面，竭盡全力地衝刺兩分鐘。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
variant of 給予|给予[ji3 yu3]
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
